instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-0165: What is 820-0165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.R7121: What is R7121? Current sense resistor between charger current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being drawn from the charger, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing power from the charger as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H around 4v, quarter fan spin, or battery not charging..
definitions.R7151: What is R7151? Current sense resistor between battery current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being sent to or drawn from the battery, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing/sending power to the battery as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H, quarter fan spin, boot looping, or battery not charging..
definitions.U5110: What is U5110? This chip is responsible for SMC_RESET_L in many Macbook models..
definitions.PP3V3_S5_AVREF_SMC: What is PP3V3_S5_AVREF_SMC? PP3V3_S5_AVREF_SMC Is a reference voltage for the SMCâ€™s voltage sensors & other sensors..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-0165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A slow, doesn't turn on automatically
threads.message:
History:
- water damage (I don't know how much), but 2 red marks are visible (1 removed though)
- SMC area was reflowed (glue not completely removed)
- <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is 8.57V
- PP3V42 is 3.43V
- battery shows 35% health, no water damage visible, could be just worn battery (forgot exactly how many cycles, but I think more than 600)

As for the laptop, it starts when I hold Shift-Power after 5-10 seconds. In OS it is slow, mouse works normal however.

Doesn't start automatically when charger is connected.
Doesn't react when Power button is pressed.
J4800 is clean.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-0165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A slow, doesn't turn on automatically
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-0165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A slow, doesn't turn on automatically
threads.message: Yeah being someone messed with it, forewarning this one could really suck. The slowness is likely a sensor issue. First try a known good trackpad/trackpad flex, keyboard, battery, and I/O board/cable if possible to rule out a hardware issue.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-0165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A slow, doesn't turn on automatically
threads.message: I've disconnected everything. Should it start automatically when charger is connected?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-0165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A slow, doesn't turn on automatically
threads.message: Yes it should. Does it? AS LONG AS it is an OEM magsafe these 2015-17 boards are VERY VERY picky about the charger.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-0165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A slow, doesn't turn on automatically
threads.message:
It should, but it only starts in SMC bypass mode in your case.
Post A/BMON sensors output voltage.
Check exact value for <RESISTOR>R7121</RESISTOR>/22 and <RESISTOR>R7151</RESISTOR>/52.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-0165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A slow, doesn't turn on automatically
threads.message:
"A/BMON sensor output voltage" while it's on? I gotta grab another keyboard to turn it on then.

<RESISTOR>R7121</RESISTOR>/22 and <RESISTOR>R7151</RESISTOR>/52 measure good, including pins on ISL.

On <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5_AVREF_SMC</SIGNAL> I get 16 Ohms. (Marked in attached picture) Doesn't sound right? 

It leads back to <CHIP>U5110</CHIP>, which is responsible for SMC Reset "Button". I get 0.4V on <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5_AVREF_SMC</SIGNAL>. So first check caps on that raiil since damage is around SMC area and better yet, they're not even changed. Whoever worked on before, probably didn't think it mattered?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-0165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A slow, doesn't turn on automatically
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5_AVREF_SMC</SIGNAL> shouldn't have such a low value.
Remove the caps first and next <CHIP>U5110</CHIP>.
If still low resistance, then reball SMC; you may have luck to be only crap underneath.
You can try first a reflow with quality flux...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-0165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A slow, doesn't turn on automatically
threads.message:
I've got an original charger. 
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5_AVREF_SMC</SIGNAL> back to its normal state. <CAPACITOR>C5021</CAPACITOR> was bad and replaced with new one.
Everything else works now.
Thanks!
Mark as solved please.
